summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between legal counsel and the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330). The communications concern the submission of a second production of materials under temporary seal, a motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena, and logistical arrangements for a pre-trial conference.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case US v. Maxwell; her chambers are the recipient of the correspondence regarding filings and procedural matters.

persons.name: Patrick Smith
persons.context: Attorney who submitted a production cover letter for the second production of materials in the case, as indicated in the attachment filename.

events.title: Final Pre-trial Conference
events.description: A final pre-trial conference was scheduled, with counsel inquiring if oral argument on a motion to quash would be heard at this conference.

events.title: Second Production Submission
events.description: The prosecution submitted its second production of materials under temporary seal in the case US v. Maxwell, with access credentials to be provided separately.

events.title: Motion to Quash Filed
events.description: A motion to quash the defendant's Rule 17(c) subpoena was filed under temporary seal, along with supporting exhibits.

keyFacts: The document pertains to procedural filings in the criminal case US v. Maxwell (docket 20cr330).
Multiple submissions, including a motion to quash and a second production of materials, were made under temporary seal.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is the presiding judge, and her chambers managed the communication regarding these sealed filings.
A final pre-trial conference was scheduled, indicating the case was in its advanced stages before trial.
